cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi south of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across Cuba, then turning NW across the Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Texas) by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-western Louisiana coast (roughly between Lake Charles LA and Port Arthur TX)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the upper Texas shoreline is inside the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible late Wed night into Thu, gusts higher if the system strengthens before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: On-shore flow ahead of Laura could drive 3–6 ft of surge along the lower Mississippi Delta and coastal Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain capable of producing 4–8 inches, localized higher totals, from late Wednesday through Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands, very rough seas and dangerous surf along approaches to the Mississippi River.
